attributes.action: Make NHS prescriptions and healthcare free for all Universal Credit claimants
attributes.background: Universal Credit claimants are being denied the free prescriptions and NHS dental care they are entitled to because doctors and dentists don't know whether they are eligible for it. Claimants for some of the benefits included in Universal Credit are entitled to free healthcare while others aren't.
attributes.additional_details:
This government’s incompetent handling of the move to Universal Credit is leaving many people already struggling with their finances, including people legally entitled to free dental care and prescriptions, going without the treatment they need because they can't afford to pay for it.

No one in Britain should have to go without healthcare because they can't afford it. Prescriptions and all NHS treatment should be free to anyone claiming Universal Credit. More information at http://bit.ly/2yzForA

attributes.action: Waive liability of dog owners when an intruder is attacked in the home.
attributes.background: It seems there is a lot of confusion and unclear legislation regarding ‘liability’ if an intruder is bitten by a dog in the dogs home? This needs clarifying urgently along with clarity in respect to signage placed at the property, it should also be legislated in the view of protecting non criminals.
attributes.additional_details: A dog is naturally territorial although a lot of breeds, usually smaller would not attack an intruder due to size difference, a lot of perfectly well rounded large breeds would indeed feel threatened by an intruder entering ‘their’ secure territory. I am an ex British Army dog handler and find it abhorrent that the government cannot back up its citizens in a way they should. A person can be educated on the laws of ‘minimum force deemed necessary’ but how do you teach a dog not to defend itself.

attributes.action: Stop! No prisoners should be allowed to have the vote
attributes.background: The Government is planning to give some prisoners the vote. The Government should hold firm and not back down to the ECHR. Prisoners lose their right to vote by committing crimes. This is a bonkers decision. The decision should be for UK parliament, not the ECHR. No prisoners should have the vote.

attributes.action: Stop UK foreign aid to all countries that mistreat minorities in appalling ways.
attributes.background:
Spending of foreign aid has to be used to the benefit of all citizens. Countries, such as Pakistan, that continue to mistreat their minorities must not receive aid any longer: 
Asia Bibi, Christian mother of five, in prison for alleged blasphemy since 2010. 
Ahmadi mosque attacked, Chakwal, 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
References:
Asia Bibi:
bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-38222680
Ahmadi mosque attack:
dw.com/en/the-persecution-of-ahmadis-in-pakistan-and-beyond/a-36748924
More examples:
Pakistani Christian school-boy beaten to death by Muslim classmates; Death sentence for Christian accused of WhatsApp “blasphemy”:
barnabasfund.org/Prayer/Prayer-Focus-1017#pakistan
Indian Church,Bibles torched in attack:
barnabasfund.org/Prayer/Prayer-Focus-1017#india
Afghan ex-Muslim persecuted:
youtube.com/watch?v=Tr_VGtTV8yY

attributes.action: FREE Junior use of council sports fields/ pitches and a cap on the Adult price.
attributes.background:
Get the Government to make local sports fields/pitches owned by local councils FREE for use by junior sports teams (Under 18) and immediate Cap on the cost for Adult sport teams. 
Councils are looking to earn money Instead of keeping our society fit and healthy!
SAVE OUR CHILDREN'S HEALTH!
attributes.additional_details:
Leeds City Council’s Charges risen by 15.9% in 5 years.

2012/13 season... 
Adults: £521 per team, per pitch 
Junior: £191 per team, per pitch

2017-18 season current charges.. 
Adults: £604 per team, per pitch 
Junior: £221 per team, per pitch
Mini: £110 per team, per pitch

The prices charged for pitches in Leeds goes up most years', meaning less Children can get involved with their local sports club as the price becomes a barrier for some families, especially those on low incomes or benefits

attributes.action: Make sign language part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Communication should be for all. By making British sign language part of the curriculum, we would offer inclusion and equality for those using signing to support their daily communication. Learning signing would enable all children to interact despite their disability.
attributes.additional_details:
Following Down's Syndrome day and working in the early years sector my passion for this has spiked. 
We learn to communicate during our early years and language is something we hear all around us everyday to enable us to communicate effectively, yet we don't all consider teaching signing as routine to enable communication for all. Doing this would offer inclusion for those using signing daily and enable others to communicate with their peers.

attributes.action: Ban non-biodegradable plastics for single use items
attributes.background: Most single use plastics take over a century to decomposes which is causing a large issue when trying to dispose of it. Non-biodegradable plastics build up in our landfill sites, rivers and oceans affecting a number of bird and marine species. So why not just make single use plastics biodegradable?
attributes.additional_details:
Biodegradable plastics are a better alternative to non-biodegradable plastics because they can be recycled, reused and require less energy to produce.   
We must look to a better and more sustainable future,
Please sign this petition and let’s take action!

attributes.action: Make all types of packaging 100% recyclable or biodegradable
attributes.background: All forms of packaging for every type of product made within, imported to or exported from the UK should be 100% recyclable or biodegradable

attributes.action: Same sex married couples should be able to divorce on grounds of adultery
attributes.background: When the UK Government welcomed same sex marriage and updated the Marriage Act accordingly, they neglected to sufficiently update the divorce law. We are now living in a country where same sex couples cannot divorce under the grounds of adultery. Where is the equality? Equal rights for all.
attributes.additional_details: Adultery is not legally recognised as grounds for marriage dissolution in the UK. The message this sends out is that the laws will selectively discriminate. It also shows a lack of foresight and planning - always check your dependencies (cause and effect of law changes).

attributes.action: Withdraw the UK from the European Convention on Human Rights
attributes.background: We need to restore common sense to our country. It is time to put Britain first. We need a British Bill of Rights and Responsibilities. The formal link between the British Courts and the European Court of Human Rights needs to be broken.
attributes.additional_details: The Supreme Court should be the ultimate arbiter of human rights matters in the UK

attributes.action: Make the misuse of a disabled parking bay a criminal offence.
attributes.background: It common to find, usually expensive cars using disabled bays without having a right to a Blue Badge.
attributes.additional_details: There are a number of facebook pages dedicated to bad parking which lists hundreds of cars in disabled bays not displaying a blue badge.

attributes.action: Less burden of proof for post war commonwealth citizens seeking  naturalisation
attributes.background: Commonwealth citizens who were invited to relocate during the UK's recruitment drive are now in their retirement years facing deportation. They entered the UK legally to help build post war Britain & have paid taxes in the UK. They are now discovering naturalisation was necessary but never happened.
attributes.additional_details: The 1971 Immigration Act gave people already settled in Britain Indefinite leave to Remain. These children are now adults and most are struggling to gather enough documents to convince the Home Office that they arrived before the cut off point. Some are being taken to Immigration Removal Centres, refused cancer treatment, becoming homeless and dismissed from their place of work as well as being refused any recourse to public funds which they have paid into for the past 50 plus years.

attributes.action: Expel Venezuelan Diplomats and close their Embassy in London
attributes.background: Venezuela is acting like a rogue state. Its citizens are being denied their basic rights and it’s been linked with narco-trafficking and the sales of passports to the black market. Due to the economic meltdown in Venezuela there is a high risk to UK citizens allowing Venezuelan diplomats in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Venezuelan Diplomats should be expelled and the Embassy in London closed to avoid risk to the UK:

https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/venezuela/terrorism 

https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/b090fb4z/hardtalk-isaias-medina-minister-counsellor-of-venezuela-to-the-un-20152017 

http://edition.cnn.com/2017/04/07/americas/venezuela-government-workers-syrian-passport-sales/index.html 

https://www.europarltv.europa.eu/programme/world/sakharov-prize-2017-venezuela-s-opposition-in-a-crisis-struck-country

attributes.action: Stop the proposed changes to funding for refuges and short term housing.
attributes.background: These proposals will remove the only guaranteed funding for refuges from the welfare system. Effectively preventing vulnerable women from paying part of the cost of their accommodation in refuges with housing benefit resulting in mass closures of refuges.
attributes.additional_details: Funding for supported housing paragraph 68 on page 26 of the 58 page document details the proposed changes. Housing benefit currently meets about half of refuge funding resulting in closures of many.These changes withdraw all guaranteed funding for refuges for vulnerable women fleeing abuse putting them at further risk. Closures of refuges would result in enormous increased costs for alternative housing for local authorities.

attributes.action: Halt the rollout of fingerprint scanners to police
attributes.background: The Home Office is beginning a trial of new fingerprint scanners with West Yorkshire Police. These scanners connect to an app on a police officer's phone, allowing quick checking of the person's fingerprints against criminal and immigration databases. This has not had any parliamentary scrutiny.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/police-trial-new-home-office-mobile-fingerprint-technology

https://www.liberty-human-rights.org.uk/news/blog/why-its-not-okay-police-quietly-roll-out-spot-fingerprint-scanning

attributes.action: Require shops to make all aisles wide enough for wheelchairs, scooters and prams
attributes.background: Stores are packed with as many goods as possible, regardless of the store size. Unfortunately, this means the aisle space between goods can be very small. For those in wheelchairs, using scooters, or pushing a pram, this proves to be a real problem. This is an example of indirect discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: Small aisle space can be perceived as being off-putting, embarrassing and offensive for those who are unable to move through the space with ease. This not only can have a negative impact on a personal level, but also on the store itself as some may be put off from shopping there again. We do not tend to have this issue with supermarkets due to their traditional layout of wide aisles. This petition hopes to raise awareness, whilst asking for policy to be introduced to tackle the problem.

attributes.action: Ban ALL formulas on public sale that contain microbeads.
attributes.background: The government is banning the use of microbeads in "Rinse off" products. The cosmetic companies complain that to reformulate all their products which contain microbeads would mean changing 90% of their formulas. So government's ban only covers 10% of the use of microbeads.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Nye Bevan in the Houses of Parliament celebrating the NHS.
attributes.background: The founder of the greatest achievment this country has witnessed should be recognised, by a statue in the houses of parliament.

attributes.action: All schools to offer optional sessions so children can learn about growing food
attributes.background:
In the UK we've a proud heritage in the growing of our food. Be it on farms, allotments or in our gardens. 

Sadly though, many children haven't had the pleasure of harvesting their own veg for their plate. 

We feel that children need access to areas to experience growing food for themselves.

attributes.action: Ban LED vehicle headlights
attributes.background: These new LED headlights are horrendous for drivers with any kind of light sensitivity, and probably not great for anyone. I literally put my hand in front of my eyes when a car with these lights approach. Instinctive reflex to protect my eyes, highly dangerous when driving!  Normal headlights fine.

attributes.action: Encourage Banks to form a marketplace in our communities for general services.
attributes.background: Banks need to consider how best to meet the continuing needs of households and businesses alike. There should be a marketplace in our towns where Banks can maintain a presence together which would be beneficial to those customers who prefer or need a face to face service.
attributes.additional_details: The Financial Conduct Authority have already logged my comments on this matter and will consider it in their on going regulation of the banking markets. The infirm/disabled, those lacking confidence on line, those with poor broadband provision or requiring to bank coin; cannot be done at any mobile banking alternative. All of these will be severely impacted upon should the trend of Bank closures continue.

attributes.action: Animal abuse charges to be the same as human abuse charges
attributes.background: Murder is murder, assault is assault, physical abuse is physical abuse whether it is a human or an animal anyone found murdering or assaulting an animal should be punished the same as if they had murdered/assaulted a human to the maximum extent of the law.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of animals are killed murdered, brutally beaten, or left to starve to death. The sentencing for these offences is often a minimum Unlimited fine and/or 6 months. Help to stop animal suffering by signing our petition. 

Examples: - 
http://www.da4a.org/sport.htm
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/katy-gammon-solicitor-who-locked-3391542
https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/donald-trumps-son-game-hunting-photos/

attributes.action: Extortionate TV charges for hospital patients to be stopped. Free TV in hospital
attributes.background: Ill patients are being charged extortionate prices for TV while in hospital. An example of this an 77 year old with learning disabilities who has been in hospital for two wks has been charged over 100 pounds to watch TV. They can not read a book or play on their Ipad due to being illiterate.
attributes.additional_details:
What is this doing to their mental health and wellbeing? 
How is it fair to charge someone who is ill and on a low income 10 pound a day to watch TV. 
There are so many elderly patients waiting to be able to go home but can't until they are assessed and a care plan has been put in place. This can take months. Mental health becomes effected and the risk of catching something else could cause a longer stay in hospital. Please sign to help make hospital TV free.

attributes.action: Refund Road Fund License for 4x4 Vehicles
attributes.background: Make a provision for 4x4 Vehicle Owners to obtain a refund against their Road Fund License where they have Volunteered their time, Vehicle and resources during the recent weather crisis
attributes.additional_details:
Over the last week, most of the UK has been battered by winter storms which have left thousands of people stranded, and thousands of essential workers unable to do their jobs. 

Ordinary people. Care workers, School teachers, NHS staff, shop workers, delivery drivers...Thousands of people. 

Into this mess have stepped hundreds if not thousands of 4x4 drivers who have freely given their time to venture out in the worst of the weather to rescue those stranded. 

This army of 4x4 drivers has kept so much of this country moving in the last week, do you think it out of place for a very public “Thank You” from the government?

attributes.action: Mandatory 10 year custodial sentence for people caught carrying a knife.
attributes.background: Too often we hear of the devastating effects knife crime is having on peoples lives. Families losing loved ones to cowardly attacks by malicious gangs and individuals who use knives to kill or harm others. There does not appear to be enough of a deterrent to stop this behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
Early in the last century in Glasgow, Razor Gangs were rife, cutting and slashing each other with cut throat razors. In the 1950's this behaviour had started to raise its ugly head yet again. The Judge Lord Carmont at that time saw it fit to issue 10 year sentences to those caught carrying. The impact on this crime was almost instantaneous and the Razor Gangs soon phased out.

It is also well documented that by carrying a knife that person is more likely to be a victim of a stabbing.

attributes.action: Require winter tyres on all vehicles from 1st November to 31st March each year
attributes.background: Reduce risk of accidents on roads in winter conditions. Motorists stuck on the motorways in winter like on the M74 16th-17th Jan 2018 less likely. Uncleared roads generally still passable. Makes the roads safer for those who use winter tyres already.

attributes.action: Compulsory liability insurance for dog owners, criminal offence to leave scene
attributes.background:
It is law if you damage someone's property they are entitled to compensation. 
If my dog is attacked by another dog then it's owner should pay my vet bills. It should be a criminal offence for them not to give their details. The incident/history should then be reported/recorded to authorities/vets.
attributes.additional_details:
Records of how many times dog has attacked. The owner should be made to take dog to behavioural or correction training or the dog would need to be controlled on lead or muzzled in public. 
Medical insurance should be owners choice but insurance to cover your dog attacking another dog/person compulsory. It protects both parties from expensive vet/claim costs. 
We have compulsory car insurance. Dogs feel pain, trauma and so does the owner seeing their pet attacked.
Please support.

attributes.action: Consider extenuating circumstances when determining maximum uni maintenance loan
attributes.background: University maintenance costs are expensive. Whilst loans are allocated according to household income, this policy assumes that parents are willing to help out their child with payments - something not all parents are willing to do, preventing students from doing well in or even attending university.
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to allow for students in such situations to appeal for a greater maintenance loan. It is considered unfair that students wanting to carry on their education should be held back due to their financial backgrounds, and I would argue that this too is affected by the willingness of parents to support their children. Everyone wanting to go to university should be given the opportunity to do so, and this includes maximising support for students who will struggle with living costs!

attributes.action: Introduce prostate cancer screening
attributes.background: There are often no symptoms of prostate cancer until it has spread and its too late to cure. Many lives could be saved and it would save the NHS a fortune in expensive treatments.

attributes.action: To create correct training for police who investigate rape allegations.
attributes.background:
Too many rape victims have been let down by our justice system. They themselves are made to feel like it was their fault, or they were in the wrong. 
This is not right. Do victims of theft find themselves being treated the same way?
attributes.additional_details:
70% Of women will not report a rape. 
Conviction rates for rape are far lower than other crimes, with only 5.7% of reported rape cases ending in a conviction for the perpetrator.
Correct training needs to be provided for police officers who investigate rape allegations, so these victims can be treated with respect, listened to and helped.

attributes.action: Make the waiting lists for NHS gender identity clinics shorter
attributes.background: I’m a trans young person with mental health difficulties & I’m currently on a 2 year waiting list for a gender identity clinic. I feel like this waiting time is detrimental to my mental health difficulties & the long waiting time isn’t fair on myself or other trans people experiencing the same thing
attributes.additional_details: Long waiting times for specialist treatment can not only cause someone with gender dysphoria to go downhill, but it can be so frustrating and upsetting for trans people and their families. It takes a lot of courage to come out as trans and the long waiting times make us feel unimportant. Feeling as if you’re in the wrong body and being so desperate to change is really challenging and I feel like we should be able access support sooner.

attributes.action: Make it impossible to claim benefits totalling more than the minimum wage
attributes.background:
Nobody on benefits should be able to claim more money per month than a person working full time in a minimum wage job.

How do we expect people to find work if they would be worse off working than on benefits.

Exceptions to this rule should only be made to disabled and elderly people.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public&private holiday services to be under an ombudsman
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for providers of holidays whether it be a public or private service,to be under an ombudsman. This allows there to be a fair and impartial assessment of dispute cases to stop those acting independently from treating customers unfairly when they are not willing to negotiate.

attributes.action: Stop extradition to the UAE
attributes.background: No Brit has been extradited from the UK to the UAE since 2010, but growing extradition requests from the UAE incur millions of pounds in costs for the UK taxpayer. The UK must suspend or withdraw from the extradition treaty with the UAE until the UAE can uphold human rights.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government is aware of – and holds - extensive and reliable evidence of human rights violations in the UAE. This includes evidence from British lawyer David Haigh, who was imprisoned without charge in Dubai for over 15 months, with no police investigation or formal interviews about the allegations against him. He was tortured and sexually abused. With others unjustly accused by the UAE, he continues to fight against extradition. http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-glasgow-west-42027115

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory labelling for meat from animals reared with antibiotics.
attributes.background: Increasing bacterial antibiotic resistance is "one of the biggest threats to global health" (WHO). Agricultural use of antibiotics in the UK is decreasing (UK-VARSS), but knowledge of the threat to public health is limited. Labelling would increase knowledge and encourage consumer choice.
attributes.additional_details:
Awareness of the threat of antibiotic resistance is increasing. Public health measures to deal with it have focussed on correct use and prescription of therapeutic antibiotics. However, there is less knowledge of the threat posed by veterinary antibiotics.

A food labelling regime would raise awareness of this issue, and support the ongoing aim of reducing use. It also informs consumers about agricultural practice on imported food, which will be more important after Brexit.

attributes.action: Make crossing patrols mandatory outside schools and consistency in policing area
attributes.background: Recently we as parents have been worried about the kids crossing a main road with no patrol. Although these services are not mandatory they should be. Children can not see over the parked cars outside of schools, this then heightens the risk for children crossing the road. Consistency
attributes.additional_details: This is an issue all over in many schools and it’s down to parents really. Many parents of running late or whatever reason seem to think the yellow zigzag lines are drop off or pick up points, when in fact they are putting other children in danger. Its Time to clampdown and do something about it.we need to solve the issue make these areas mandatory to have a crossing whether it be a pelican, zebra crossing or a crossing patrol. Something needs done. More than just a fine as it’s not preventing this

attributes.action: Reverse the government plans to remove women's refuges from the welfare system.
attributes.background: Katie Ghose, the chief executive of Women’s Aid, said: “The government’s proposed reforms to supported housing will dismantle our national network of lifesaving refuges and put the lives of women and children trying to escape domestic abuse at risk. This is a matter of life or death.”
attributes.additional_details:
Katie Ghose, the chief executive of Women’s Aid told the Guardian

 “If pursued, the reforms will result in a postcode lottery of domestic abuse support services, with ... refuges being forced to close their doors and more women and children being turned away from the lifesaving support they offer,” she said.

The reforms fly in the face of pledges made by the prime minister to make it a key personal priority to transform the way the UK tackles domestic violence.

attributes.action: Change the legal driving age to 16
attributes.background: At 16, you can get married and have children, drive a motor bike but you can’t drive a car, this is unfair.

attributes.action: Automatically give custodial sentences to those who steal from vulnerable people
attributes.background: I would like the Government to change the law so that people who steal from vulnerable people when they are working in a position of trust are automatically given a custodial sentence.

attributes.action: Give all National Health workers free parking and free public transport.
attributes.background: for the last seven years National Health workers have had a pay freeze. But are still expected to pay parking fees to park at work which can be anything up to 10% of their wages, by giving them all free parking and free public transport.This would be like giving them a 5-6% pay rise

attributes.action: Make sending unsolicited pictures of penises illegal
attributes.background: Women are being sent many unwanted photographs of penises, it is just as distressing as in the flesh which is already covered by indecent exposure laws.
attributes.additional_details: We need everyone to know that an unwanted penis is unwanted whether it is in the flesh or in a photograph. You should have a communication trail to prove it was wanted.

attributes.action: Full-scale independent inquiry into mismanagement of all UK rail transport.
attributes.background: From potentially illegal treatment of passengers by train companies during the recent "Beast from the East" cold snap, through failing franchises and unjustifiable price increases, to the most recent abortive failure of the 26-30 Railcard; British railway transport is at an unacceptable nadir. Why?
attributes.additional_details:
Why were passengers not evacuated for 15 hours? Or provided with food, water, or blankets for 15 hours?
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5453487/Passengers-stuck-train-no-heating-toilets-15-HOURS.html

Why did Southeastern ignore their own health and safety legislation? Who will ensure this doesn't happen again?
http://buzzsteam.com/2018/03/04/southeastern-commuter-train-stuck-at-lewisham/

Is incompetent mismanagement of our trains putting members of the public at unnecessary risk?

attributes.action: Ban Bird Scarers In residential areas. A law instead of NFU code to be made.
attributes.background: Bird scarers are being used more frequently in residential areas by farmers. Their noise level is 165 dB, their frequency during the day is too often and they are disturbing people trying to live a normal life. Everyone has the right to a quiet life. This is antisocial behaviour which needs ending.
attributes.additional_details:
Environmental Healrh do not have enough power to stop this practice due to an outdated NFU code of practice. The laws need changing to include this as a
Noise nuisance. It effects shift workers, pets, sale of houses, mental health and every day life. Birds fly away, humans can’t. Birds get used to it and go to where the sound is as they know there is food. 

They need to be banned completely in residential areas. They cause untold misery for many.

attributes.action: For the campaign #askforangela to be a government backed national roll out
attributes.background: A simple code-word campaign for people feeling unsafe on a date. It encourages people to discreetly ask for help by going to the bar and ' Ask for Angela' - a phrase aimed at alerting bar staff to the cry for help so they can help defuse the situation discretely and without fuss.
attributes.additional_details:
A woman has successfully used the ‘Ask for Angela’ safety scheme to remove herself from a difficult situation during a night out.

A number of pubs across the country offer the scheme, which aims to reduce sexual violence and vulnerability by providing men and women with a subtle phrase they can use to get out of uncomfortable or potentially dangerous circumstances.

One pub in Gloucester successfully helped a female patron to do just that.

attributes.action: Create a new minimum wage called the Qualified minimum wage.
attributes.background: When a person is trained or qualified to do a job, they should automatically qualify for the qualified minimum wage (in line with the age group)  which is a higher rate to recognise the skill.
attributes.additional_details:
I understand that at the moment there is no national recognised wage for a qualified person. Therefore there is no incentive to invest in training or learning a trade. 
Weather you are a nurse, plumber, driver, dental nurse or brick layer. Skills should be recognised.

attributes.action: Add a limit to the maximum amount of persons allowed on a commercial train.
attributes.background:
Trains in the UK (especially in the North) are overcrowded with the companies regularly citing new trains coming and a lack thereof as a reason for such poor service. 
People are crammed in like cattle and are forced to stand within less than 30 cm of each other every day. No H/S limit is enforced.
attributes.additional_details:
You only need to commute on one in the morning to see this problem occur. Stations get missed, companies charge exuberant prices, people get crushed, people overheat (no air con on a lot of trains) and nothing is being done about it.

An office has a maximum limit to the persons allowed on a Health and Safety grounds, as do many other businesses and services (bus's do too). Why not trains?

attributes.action: Save the Streetlighting on the A2 between Bexley and Dartford
attributes.background: The streetlights on this section of the A2 have recently been switched off. On further investigation it appears Highways England are to remove the lighting columns as they are life expired. This is ridiculous and a dangerous decision on such a busy road. Please help me to get the decision reversed.
attributes.additional_details: I spoke to a Highways England who confirmed that they were being removed. Only to tell me that the white lines would be refreshed as if that would suffice!

attributes.action: Create"National Unity Day" UK-wide bank holiday to celebrate all that unites us.
attributes.background: We believe the United Kingdom needs a day that celebrates and promotes the fabric of what our great country was built upon - Unity. With our nation more divided than ever, we need a day that will bring us together to celebrate all that we have in common.
attributes.additional_details:
For more details visit:
www.Diversify.org

attributes.action: Take all income into account when calculating for Child Maintenance payments
attributes.background: Take all income into account, including dividend payments for self-employed, when calculating child maintenance payments through the CMS from non-residential parents.  The current tax loop hold of payment through dividends is depriving children of income by not being included for CMS payments.
attributes.additional_details: When couples split up, they can select to calculate child maintenance payments privately, or to use the government's Child Maintenance Service (CMS). I ask that all forms of income are taken into account, including dividend payments for the self-employed, when calculating child maintenance payments through the CMS from non-residential parents.  The current tax loop hold of payment through dividends is depriving children of income by not being included for CMS payments.

attributes.action: Examine the entire policing operation in the UK.
attributes.background: Policing has moved on. Crime is again predominating. Policing is asked to do more with ever decreasing numbers of officers. Yet the only section of the police family that is suffering is the front line. A fundamental change is needed.
attributes.additional_details: There is no longer justification for 43 constabularies with all the expenditure associated with them. We need a major re-think. Budget saved would be used to increase front line officers delivering policingthe through a streamlined, efficient leadership model. Supported financially by the sale of headquarters buildings the service can become more visual as should be the case. The knock on effect would also mean the reduction of Crime Commissioners and their entourage within a refirmed structure.
